key_facts: The WMO issued a 'red alert' warning about global warming.
Greenhouse gas levels are at record highs.
Ice is melting at accelerated rates.
2024 is likely to surpass 2023 as the hottest year on record.
The 12-month average from March 2023 to February 2024 exceeded 1.5°C warming.
The 1.5°C threshold is set by the Paris Agreement.
UN Secretary-General António Guterres called the situation a 'planet on the brink.'
Guterres urged action against fossil fuel emissions.
El Niño is contributing to recent warming.
Human-driven emissions are the primary cause of global warming.
The WMO urges urgent emissions reductions.
Climate records continue to be broken.
The world is close to breaching climate limits.
Breaching climate limits could have far-reaching consequences.
